item.title: Elderly Perth woman killed during burglary, police say
item.description: A 70-year-old woman whose body was found in her Perth home last week was killed during a burglary, Western Australian police say.

media:group.media:description: Police said they believed Valeria Fermendjin was killed in a bungled robbery. (Supplied)

item.title: Queensland's kilt maker of choice when only thistle do
item.description: Meet one of the last people in Australia who hand-makes tartan kilts 365 days a year.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Hinchliffe

media:group.media:description: Karen Manger shows the handiwork in each of the kilts. (612 ABC Brisbane: Jessica Hinchliffe)

item.title: Major parties dig in against NSW electoral boundary changes
item.description: Both major parties have objected to the proposed electoral boundaries changes in NSW.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Anderson

media:group.media:description: Senator John Williams argues any seat named after late PM Gough Whitlam should be in Sydney. (AAP: Stefan Postles)

item.title: Reigning Tour Down Under champ 'wants to make history'
item.description: Tour Down Under reigning champion, Rohan Dennis, will make history if he wins back-to-back, but is remaining modest leading into next week's race.
item.dc:creator: Nicola Gage

media:group.media:description: Rohan Dennis with Cadel Evans after stage six of the Tour Down Under last year. (Getty Images: Morne de Klerk)

item.title: Live: Australia battles India in first ODI of summer
item.description: India has won the toss and will bat first in the first ODI against Australia at the WACA. Join Grandstand Online's live coverage.
item.dc:creator: Dean Bilton And Dan Colasimone

media:group.media:description: A spectator waves his flag in support as Andrew Strauss of England is dismissed by Ryan Harris of Australia during day two of the third Ashes Test at the WACA ground on December 17, 2010. (Getty Images: Paul Kane)

item.title: Energy Resources of Australia reviews its Ranger uranium mine
item.description: The operator of the Ranger uranium mine in the Northern Territory is considering the mine's future after the Mirarr traditional owners advise they do not support an extension past the 2021 lease.

media:group.media:description: The Ranger uranium mine, which the Mirrar do not want mined past 2021. (ABC TV)

item.title: Children in war zones 'at risk of losing their futures'
item.description: Nearly one in four children growing up in conflict zones are missing out on education, UNICEF says, warning those unable to learn face bleak future prospects.

media:group.media:description: Iraqi security forces help an injured boy who, with his family, fled hunger and jihadist rule in Hawijah in January, 2016. (AFP)

item.title: Families SA supervisor 'can't remember' why she closed baby Ebony file
item.description: A Families SA supervisor tells an inquest "I really don't know why I closed" four-month-old baby Ebony's case file a month before the girl's death in 2011.
item.dc:creator: James Hancock

media:group.media:description: Both Ebony's parents pleaded guilty to criminal neglect after the four-month-old's death. (Supplied)

item.title: Germy children's toys removed from GP waiting rooms
item.description: The National Health Co-op in Canberra moves to permanently remove children's toys from its GP waiting rooms.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Walmsley

media:group.media:description: Children's toys in medical centre waiting rooms can become a breeding ground for germs. (Clarissa Thorpe: ABC News)

item.title: Barwon Health website targeted by pro-Palestinian hackers
item.description: Barwon Health's website is taken down after it was apparently hacked on Tuesday morning and the words "I am a Muslim and #ISIS does not represent me" appeared across the site.
item.dc:creator: Margaret Paul

item.title: Man faces court over 2014 cafe arson attack
item.description: Leo Nicholas Eliadas faces court charged with deliberately setting fire to Brierly's Cafe in Weston in March 2014 after breaching his bail conditions.
item.dc:creator: Alexandra Beech

media:group.media:description: CCTV still showing an alleged arson at a Weston cafe, which Leo Nicholas Eliadas is charged with committing. (Supplied: ACT Policing)

item.title: Higher milk, bread prices under effects test: former ACCC boss
item.description: Former ACCC chairman Graeme Samuel warns that introducing an "effects test" will leave consumers paying more for bread and milk.
item.dc:creator: Thuy Ong

media:group.media:description: Graeme Samuel has warned that supermarket giants may be prosecuted for offering cheap milk if the law changes. (facet.org)

item.title: Bill Shorten challenges Malcolm Turnbull to GST debate
item.description: The Federal Opposition Leader challenges the Prime Minister to a public debate on the GST, after NSW Labor leader Luke Foley indicates he may support an increase.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Anderson

media:group.media:description: Bill Shorten talks to the media at Queanbeyan Woolworths to voice his opposition to increasing the GST to 15 per cent. (ABC News: Nicholas Haggarty)

item.title: AFLPA says banned Bombers players did nothing wrong
item.description: AFL Players' Association chief Paul Marsh says Essendon players banned for doping have done nothing wrong, and flags "very high" chance of legal action against the club.

media:group.media:description: AFLPA chief Paul Marsh says Essendon captain Jobe Watson (C) is "shattered" by the CAS doping decision. (Getty Images: Quinn Rooney)

item.title: SA's Police Minister resigns from Cabinet
item.description: Tony Piccolo announces he will resign as South Australian Police Minister, ahead of a planned Cabinet reshuffle.
item.dc:creator: Angelique Donnellan

media:group.media:description: SA's Police Minister Tony Piccolo has resigned from Cabinet. (ABC News)

item.title: 'Fake firefighter' charged with stealing
item.description: A man allegedly impersonating a firefighter, who arrived at a fire south of Perth, is charged with stealing.

media:group.media:description: A firefighter at the scene of a bushfire in the Perth suburb of Baldivis. February 23, 2015. (Supplied: John Dobson)

item.title: Building site evacuated after gas explosion
item.description: A gas explosion prompts the evacuation of a building site at Bondi in Sydney's east.

media:group.media:description: A building site at Bondi was evacuated after a gas explosion. (ABC News)

item.title: Milky Way growth chart reveals how galaxy evolved
item.description: Scientists create a map that charts the ages of stars across the Milky Way, confirming that our galaxy grew from the inside out.

media:group.media:description: This image shows the latest results as coloured dots superimposed on an artist's conception of the Milky Way. Red dots show stars that formed when the Milky Way was young and small 12 - 13 billion years ago, while blue shows stars that formed more recently 1- 2 billion years ago, when the Milky Way was big and mature. (M Ness and G Stinson/MPIA)

item.title: TasWater 'soul-searching' over handling of E. coli water contamination
item.description: Tasmania's water and sewerage authority will review how it handled an E. coli water contamination in Wynyard, in the state's north west, after locals complained they warned five days too late.

media:group.media:description: Some residents in Wynyard in Tasmania's north west complained more was not done to inform and manage the water quality problem. (Photo: www.abc.net.au/news/tv)

item.title: Hundreds of Victorian children left in hot cars last month
item.description: Paramedics rescued hundreds of children from hot cars in Victoria in the first month of summer, with an average of seven left unattended each day.

media:group.media:description: On one day in December, 13 children were left in cars in 37 degree heat. (ABC News)

item.title: Hot Brisbane weather may come as 'shock' to residents: BoM
item.description: A string of hotter than usual temperatures forecast for Brisbane this week may come as a "shock to the system" for residents, the weather bureau says.
item.dc:creator: Alle McMahon

media:group.media:description: Temperatures in Brisbane are set to peak at 33 degrees Celsius today. (AAP: Dave Hunt)

item.title: Live: AFL community outraged over season ban for Bombers
item.description: ASADA's boss hits out at Essendon players handed year-long bans for their parts in the Bombers supplements scandal, amid speculation over whether captain Jobe Watson will get to keep his Brownlow. Follow our live blog for all the reaction.

media:group.media:description: Tom Bellchambers and Jobe Watson of the Bombers celebrates during the round one AFL match between the Adelaide Crows and the Essendon Bombers at Football Park on March 22, 2013. (Morne de Klerk: Getty Images)

item.title: Body found on NSW beach believed to be missing swimmer
item.description: A man's body is found on the beach at Hawks Nest, north of Newcastle, days after a swimmer became caught in a rip and went missing.

media:group.media:description: A red flag, signifying a closed beach, flies in strong winds at Main Beach on Stradbroke Island, off the SE Qld coast near Brisbane, March 2009. (Giulio Saggin, file photo: ABC News)

item.title: Residents of fire-ravaged Yarloop return to inspect damage
item.description: Residents who fled a devastating bushfire at Yarloop south of Perth are being allowed back into the town to inspect their properties, but will not be allowed to stay.
item.dc:creator: Graeme Powell

media:group.media:description: Yarloop buildings were razed to ground by the big South West bushfire. (ABC News)

item.title: Preschoolers using app to learn foreign languages
item.description: Fifty years ago, 40 per cent of Year 12 students studied a second language compared to just 12 per cent today. But it is hoped an app targeted at preschoolers will turn things around.
item.dc:creator: Penny Timms

media:group.media:description: Children are exposed to languages through characters greeting and speaking to them. (ABC: Emily Bryan)

item.title: Dapto TAFE to close by the end of next week
item.description: After many months of speculation, it's been confirmed that the TAFE campus at Dapto will close before the end of January.

media:group.media:description: The Dapto TAFE campus will close before the end of January. (ABC News: Dan Cox)

item.title: Horses treated for burns after Yarloop fire
item.description: Eleven horses that were trapped near the town of Yarloop in Western Australia's South West as fire tore through the area are being treated for severe burns.

media:group.media:description: A horse receives medical treatment after being burnt in the Yarloop bushfire. (Supplied: Ross Wallace)

item.title: 'Miscarriage of justice': Hird scathing of Bombers bans
item.description: Former Essendon coach James Hird has condemned the Court of Arbitration for Sport's decision to find 34 former and current Bombers players guilty of doping offences, labelling it as a "miscarriage of justice".

media:group.media:description: Unfair decision ... James Hird (Getty Images: Cameron Spencer, File Photo)

item.title: Dick Smith CEO Abboud resigns, Grover to take over
item.description: Dick Smith's chief executive Nick Abboud has resigned after the electronics retailer he ran went into receivership a week ago.
item.dc:creator: Michael Janda

media:group.media:description: The receivers Ferrier Hodgson say more than 40 expressions of interest have been received to buy Dick Smith. (AAP: Julian Smith)

item.title: Classic hip hop group De La Soul to perform at Womadelaide festival
item.description: Grammy Award-winning American hip hop group De La Soul will perform at the Womadelaide music and dance festival in March.

media:group.media:description: De La Soul will perform at Womadelaide in an exclusive Australian appearance during March. (Supplied: Womadelaide)

item.title: Doctor caught on camera throwing deadly punch detained in Russia
item.description: Russian authorities detain a surgeon ahead of his trial for negligence after he punched a patient causing his death in an attack captured on video.

media:group.media:description: The deadly punch reportedly occurred in late December.

item.title: ASADA backs Essendon supplement bans
item.description: ASADA has described the Essendon supplement saga as an "unfortunate episode" that has "chronicled the most devastating self-inflicted injury by a sporting club in Australian history".

media:group.media:description: Players stretch during an Essendon Bombers AFL training session at Windy Hill on August 23, 2012. (Getty Images: Robert Prezioso, File Photo)

item.title: Crude oil prices plunge to fresh 12-year low
item.description: Oil prices plunge to a fresh 12-year low as Chinese demand weakens at the same time as supply increases.
item.dc:creator: David Taylor

media:group.media:description: Crude oil prices have fallen almost 16 per cent in just six trading days so far in 2016. (Guang Niu, File photo: Getty Images)

item.title: Man fighting for life after Melbourne house fire
item.description: A man is fighting for his life in hospital and a woman has serious injuries after a fire destroyed a home in Melbourne's west. A baby was unharmed in the blaze.

media:group.media:description: A man sustained burns to most of his body in the house fire. (ABC News)

item.title: New Zealand unable to accept refugees from Nauru, Manus Island
item.description: New Zealand confirms it is unable to accept refugees from Nauru and Manus Island this year, after Australia opts not to go through with a deal signed by former prime minister Julia Gillard.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Anderson

media:group.media:description: Supplied image of tent accommodation at the federal government's offshore detention centre in Nauru, Friday, Sept. 14, 2012. (AAP Image: Department of Immigration)

item.title: Alice Springs woman allegedly stabbed in neck with broken bottle
item.description: Police in Alice Springs are searching for a 59-year-old man who allegedly stabbed his female partner in the neck with a broken bottle.

item.title: Helicopter pilot critical after Antarctica crevasse fall
item.description: A helicopter pilot critically injured in Antarctica when he fell 20 metres down a crevasse may be flown to mainland Australia for treatment.

media:group.media:description: One of the helicopters used to transport expeditioners and stores in Antarctica (Supplied: AAD)

item.title: Singapore Airlines welcome in Canberra: ACT Government
item.description: The ACT Government says it would welcome direct international flights into Canberra, but cannot confirm reports that Singapore Airlines is launching services to the national capital.

media:group.media:description: The first Airbus A380 superjumbo jet to be delivered to Singapore Airlines is seen at Toulouse-Blagnac airport, France, October 14, 2007, the day before it was handed over to the airline. (Singapore Airlines: AFP)

item.title: Forestry industry behind woodchip export jump, 'not Government'
item.description: Tasmania's forestry industry, and not the State Government, can claim credit for a significant jump in woodchip exports over the past 12 months, the Opposition and the Greens say.
item.dc:creator: Jane Ryan

media:group.media:description: Forico re-opened the former Gunns woodchip mill at Hampshire, near Burnie after a 5 year closure. (ABC Rural: Alexandra Blucher)

item.title: Baby girl poisoned on Gold Coast, father in custody
item.description: A man is remanded in custody over the alleged poisoning of his two-month-old daughter on the Gold Coast.

item.title: Highest death toll for three months in multiple Iraq attacks
item.description: Multiple attacks in Iraq kill more than 50 people and injure more than 90 in a rapid escalation of violence, leaving the highest death toll for three months.

media:group.media:description: Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, which it said targeted "rejectionist heathens". (AFP)

item.title: Wall St wobbles as crude oil prices plunge again
item.description: Wall Street struggles in volatile trade to finish in mixed territory, weighed down by weakness in China causing commodity prices to slump.
item.dc:creator: Thuy Ong

media:group.media:description: Even though most US indices finished broadly flat, a slide in oil price created market jitters. (REUTERS: Brendan McDermid)

item.title: The Essendon supplements saga from start to finish
item.description: After three years, and millions of dollars, the CAS judgement has finally brought the whole Essendon supplements saga to an end.
item.dc:creator: Andrew McGarry

media:group.media:description: The Essendon supplements saga has resulted in many senior figures leaving the club, including former coach James Hird and chairman Paul Little. (AAP Image: Joe Castro)

item.title: Essendon players banned for 12 months after being found guilty of doping
item.description: The Court of Arbitration for Sport upholds WADA's appeal of the AFL anti-doping tribunal's Essendon verdict, with 34 past and present Bombers players to miss the entire 2016 season.

media:group.media:description: A dozen current Bombers players and five players now at other clubs will miss the 2016 season after the Court of Arbitration for Sport upheld WADA's appeal. (Getty Images: Mark Dadswell)

item.title: Man orders Kindle, receives human tumour
item.description: An Englishman who ordered a Kindle mistakenly receives a human tumour specimen after a courier company mixes up his order.

media:group.media:description: James Potten received this tumour specimen instead of his Kindle. (Twitter: James Potten)

item.title: Oscar Pistorius lodges appeal over murder conviction
item.description: Oscar Pistorius's lawyers file an appeal in South Africa's Constitutional Court against the Paralympic champion's murder conviction for shooting Reeva Steenhamp dead.

media:group.media:description: Oscar Pistorius's legal team have filed an application for leave to appeal his murder conviction to the Constitutional Court. (AFP: POOL: Siphiwe Sibeko)

item.title: Many Australians 'dying with large superannuation balances'
item.description: Many Australians are dying richer than the day they retired because they are only withdrawing the government-mandated minimum amount from their super to live on, new research shows.
item.dc:creator: Justine Parker

media:group.media:description: The Finance Minister Scott Bacon says it will be a challenge to meet the budget forecast. (ABC)

item.title: Tugboat workers' strike affects Newcastle, Sydney and Geelong
item.description: Shipping has come to a standstill in the ports of Newcastle, Sydney and Geelong today, with tugboat engineers launching strike action early this morning.

media:group.media:description: A strike by tugboat engineers has affected the Port of Newcastle today. (Supplied by Forgacs)

item.title: Teenage music photographer at home in press pit
item.description: Sian Sandilands has been to more gigs than most people twice her age, and she has the photos to prove it.

media:group.media:description: It isn't heavy metal without a crowd throwing the horns. (Sian Sandilands)

item.title: Key evidence in case against war crimes suspect 'Captain Dragan' handed over
item.description: A witness in a Croatian criminal case against Australian citizen Dragan Vasiljkovic hands prosecutors a recording of a press conference that implicates the paramilitary commander in war crimes.

media:group.media:description: Dragan Vasiljkovic was charged with murdering and torturing civilians and prisoners of war during Croatia's war of independence. (Reuters, file photo)

item.title: Melbourne tyre blaze may burn for several days: firefighters
item.description: Fire crews in Melbourne gain control of a large blaze burning through 150,000 tyres at a yard in Broadmeadows, but warn it may take several days to extinguish.

media:group.media:description: The blaze sent a plume of toxic, black smoke across suburbs neighbouring Broadmeadows. (ABC News: Stephanie Anderson)

item.title: Aid reaches starving Syrian town under siege
item.description: An aid convoy reaches the Syrian town of Madaya where at least 28 residents are believed to have starved to death in the last month.

item.title: Click here to plead guilty: Online shake-up planned for SA courts
item.description: Guilty pleas might be submitted online under a technology shake-up planned for South Australia's legal system.
item.dc:creator: Angelique Donnellan

media:group.media:description: Digital technology is being sought to end so many legal documents being kept in paper form. (ABC News)

item.title: Adelaide family of five dies in car crash in India
item.description: Friends of an Adelaide family, including two children, killed in a road crash near New Delhi describe them as "very loving".

media:group.media:description: Anamika Datta (left) was killed in a vehicle crash while holidaying in India. Her husband, Rupendra Datta suffered critical injuries. (Facebook)

item.title: A sneak peek inside life working as a chef in Antarctica
item.description: From burgers to birthday cakes, The Australian Antarctic Division's chef divulges some of the secrets of the Antarctica stations. And it's not all tinned food and packaged food coming out of the kitchens.

item.title: Barcelona's Lionel Messi wins Ballon d'Or
item.description: The Barcelona superstar claims FIFA's award for the world's best footballer for the fifth time, dethroning great rival Cristiano Ronaldo.

media:group.media:description: Five star performance ... Barcelona's Argentinian superstar, Lionel Messi, has beaten Cristiano Ronaldo and Neymar to win FIFA's Ballon d'Or award for the fifth time. (Getty Images: Matthias Hangst)

item.title: Construction in the sky with a high-rise crane crew

item.title: Fans around the world pay tribute to rock legend David Bowie

item.title: Extraditing El Chapo to US could take a year: Mexico

media:group.media:description: Drug kingpin Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman's extradition to the United States could take at least a year. (AFP: Alfredo Estrella)

item.title: Air strike kills 12 children at Syrian school: monitor
item.description: Bombs dropped by suspected Russian warplanes kill at least 12 Syrian children at a school in a rebel-held town in Aleppo province, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reports.

media:group.media:description: Russia has been carrying out air strikes in Syria since September. (Ministry of Defence of the Russian Federation)

item.title: Shorten returns from leave to face questions on union corruption
item.description: The Federal Opposition Leader gets back to work today with the final report from the trade union royal commission casting a shadow over his attempts to campaign against the Government on issues such as the GST.

item.title: Indian court postpones hit-and-run driver extradition case

item.title: David Bowie's final album Blackstar a 'parting gift'
item.description: Fans are speculating the meaning of David Bowie's final album, released just days before his death to coincide with his 69th birthday, which has been described as the rock icon's "parting gift".

item.title: Trucks carrying aid leave for starving Syrian town of Madaya

item.title: Renegades keep BBL finals hopes alive with win over Thunder

item.title: Minister says people 'of foreign origin' behind nearly all Cologne criminal acts

item.title: Bowie at the bar: The outback pub beamed around the world
item.description: In the tiny town of Carinda in western NSW, the phone at the pub is ringing off the hook. Bartender Marie Draper is fielding calls about the death of a former patron, who 32 years ago forever linked this quiet outback town to rock and roll history.

item.title: PNG police commander takes to social media to fight sorcery killings

item.title: The songs that made David Bowie an icon
item.description: Rock legend David Bowie has died at the age of 69 after a battle with cancer, take a look back on some of the songs that made him an icon.

item.title: Motorist, police injured after cars hit chemical-laden truck

item.title: Share market falls 1.2pc as bad run continues

The Australian dollar is down almost two US cents as global markets continue to be pessimistic about the US economy and European government debt woes. (AAP: Tracey Nearmy)

item.title: How a hard to find 'girls bar' in Tokyo became headline news in NT
